result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.  As to all costs and surcharges and restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by DOC.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of Extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 646 days.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: due date entered based on this case and 15CF875.

Case recalled 2:46 pm. Appearances the same. Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by defense as to sentencing. 
 
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with credit for 646 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

The defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Court orders restitution set at $5,026.77 to Eric B.  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
As to all costs, surcharges and restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Restitution Information;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

*Dvd and photographs provided by the State and submitted for sentencing.

Sentencing hearing proceeds. Pre-sentence report reviewed. Court finds State has complied with victim notification. Statements made by state. DVD viewed in open court by state. Additional statements made by Joann C. (mother), Kimberly L. (sister), Ronsha B. (cousin). Due to time constraints and set case over to 2:30 pm.

/stipulation and order for return/destruction of exhibits, signed and filed.

Same appearances.  At the hour of 1:51pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts of GUILTY which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Defense reserves right to file post judgment motions.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court orders PSI with recommendation.   Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled on 8/12/16 at 10:00am in Br. 35.

Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds instruction conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Jury in box at 9:15am.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  HIDTA Analyst Joseph Tang.  Exhibits 40-51,53,60 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Court holds colloquy with defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waives his right to testify.  Instructions placed on the record.  Defense motion to dismiss at the close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: West Allis PD Corporal Jeffrey Zientek.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Jury out of box.  Court makes record re: stipulation as to selection of alternate juror.  Defense motion to dismiss at the close of evidence is denied by the Court.  Jury in box.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror #20 is released.  Jury retired at the hour of 12:04pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Pawlak, Wall and Walls who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Court places sidebar on the record.
Opening Instructions
Preliminary Instruction: Juror's conduct (modified)

Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in custody.  Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court hears additional argument re: Instagram photos.  Jury in box at 1:50pm.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: West Allis PD Corporal Stephen Heckler, Crime Lab Analyst Xai Xiong.  Jury out of box.  Sworn for the State (re: Instagram photos): MPD Officer Gregory Kuspa.  Court hears arguments of counsel.  Court places ruling re: Instagram photos on the record.  Jury in box.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Gregory Kuspa.  Jury out of box for break.  Court holds colloquy with defendant re: stipulation (Exhibit #56).  Jury in box.  State reads Exhibit #56 into the record.  Sworn for the State: West Allis PD Detective Thomas Carr (retired).  Excerpts of jail calls (Exhibit #68) played for the jury in open court.  Exhibits 1,3,6,9-12,23,27-32,34,37,54-57,61-68,70-71 received.  Jury released for the evening at 4:40pm.  Juror #20 remains in Court.  Juror scheduling conflict placed on the record.  Trial to continue on 6/8/16 at 8:30am in br. 35.

Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in custody.  Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in box at 8:44am.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Eric B., West Allis PD Detective Brian Haveican.  Jury out of box for break.  Court places sidebars on the record.  Jury in box.  Sworn for the state: co-actor Montrell H. with counsel, Attorney William Kerner, present in Court.  Exhibits 2,4,7,15-22,25-26,38-39,58-59,69 received.  Jury out of box at 11:41am.  Court hears argument re: State's request to allow introduction of Instagram photos.  Court takes request under advisement at this time.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour, trial to continue at 1:30pm.

Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court at 1:48pm.  Voir dire continues.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Jury is released for the evening at 4:37pm.  Court places sidebars on the record.  Trial to continue at 6/7/16 at 8:30am in Br. 35.

Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties in Court for jury trial on this case and case #15CF875.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Matter is called on the record.  Counsel places prior rulings on the record.  Court hears argument re: State's request to allow additional evidence. For reasons as stated on the record, Court denies request.  Court makes witness exclusion order.  Court places additional trial rulings on the record.  Court places gallery behavior expectations and rules on the record.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:40am.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour.  Panel is released at 11:55am.  Court places gallery admonishment on the record.  Jury selection to continue at 1:30pm.
State's Amended Witness List, filed.

Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds final pretrial conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter continues on the record.  Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for SPEEDY trial on 6/6/16 at 9:30am in Br. 35.  Parties to contact the Court 10 days prior to trial re: location of trial.

ADA Crivello contacts the Court.  Counsel is not available for FPT on 5/4/16.  Matter is adjourned to 5/5/16 at 1:30pm.  Defense counsel is in agreement.  Counsel to notify Attorney Bowe.  MCSO notified.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello (by phone) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel was recently retained.  Matter remains in trial posture.  Defense counsel intends to file speedy trial demand.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Edward Lee Wright
informs court that he will be out of the country on active duty.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Defendant to obtain new counsel. Case is adjourned for status of counsel. The court vacates the jury trial scheduled for 3/14/2016.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

proposed order for reinstatment of jail priveledges, signed and filed.

Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in custody.  Denis John Stingl for Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes record re: rescheduling of trial date. Defendant is in agreement. 12/14/15 jury trial date is removed from the calendar. Matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 2/22/16 at 9:30am in br. 35. Court hears argument re: defendent's restrictions. For reasons as stated on the record, Court vacates previous order re: restrictions. Counsel to submit order.

Attorney Edward Lee Wright in court, defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court holds conference in chambers with counsel re: scheduling. Matter is called on the record. Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct full hearing today. Defense counsel is requesting approximately an 8 week continuance of trial due to unavailability. Court hears argument. Court GRANTS request and schedules new trial date subject to conducting colloquy with defendant on next date, defendant to be produced.  ADA Crivello's appearance in waived on next date. Court hears argument re: restrictions. Court to address restrictions on next date.  Status conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney William Robert Kerner appears for material witness, Montrell Hilson. Montrell Hilson not in court, in custody.  Court orders material witness warrant in this case and case #15CF875 withdrawn. Mr. Hilson is ordered released without bail. Matter remains scheduled for status conference on 9/25/15 at 8:30am in Br. 35.

Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Walter Lorenzo Coleman in custody.  Material witness, Montrell Hilson in court with attorney William Kerner. Montrell Hilson in custody.   Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court GRANTS State's motion seeking to take a deposition of the witness, Mr. Hilson. Court finds deposition is appropriate because the witness testimony is material and the deposition is needed to prevent a failure of justice. Court finds that the deposition does not need to occur in open court pursuant to 967.04 and the rules of civil procedure. The Court will be available by telephone until 5pm today if there are any objections that require a Court ruling.
- dated 9/18/15 from Attorney Kerner, filed.

Denis Stingl for Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney William Kerner appears for material witness: Montrell Hilson (not in court, in custody). Material witness warrant was cleared by MCSO this morning. Court holds conference with counsel off the record. Court orders material witness be held until Monday, 9/21/15. State requests deposition to be conducted at that time. Both defendant and witness to be produced for deposition. Attorney Kerner requested that the witness be placed in protective custody, MCSO notified. State to notify defense counsel.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
(amended), filed. Exhibits are withdrawn.

Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury question placed on the record. Court questions jurors individually in open court. Court stands in recess for remainder of the lunch hour.
Matter is recalled (same appearances). Court places findings on the record. Court hears argument re: defense motion for mistrial. Court GRANTS motion and declares mistrial. Matter is scheduled for status conference on 9/25/15 at 8:30am and jury trial on 12/14/15 at 9:30am in Br. 35.  
Defense requests order rescinding priveledges be revoked, Court hears argument. Order to continue pending next date.
